version_description:
• New Bucktown HipstaPak
• Fixed a crash when editing a Live Photo, using the default crop, with Separate Files save mode
• Fixed a crash that could occur in some instances on app launch
• Fixed a bug causing square photos not to render as perfectly square, preventing them from being uploaded to Oggl or ordered in PrintLab (to fix existing photos, edit and re-save them after installing this update)
Inspired by vintage 1990's family vacations: the new Kissimmee HipstaPak

• The home screen icon can be changed to the classic Hipstamatic analog icon (available in Hipstamatic Settings -> App Icon, requires iOS 10.3)
• New Autochrome SnapPak, emulating early 20th century color photography
• Optimizations to fix slowdowns when opening the app and shooting (for people with large Hipstamatic libraries)
• Fixed a crash that could occur when editing a Favorite Preset
• Fix for bug preventing some users from installing older films (such as Ina's 1969)
• Smooth out some jerky UI animations in some places
Improvements to image uploading when ordering prints from PrintLab over a slow network connection

• New Hanalei HipstaPak, a collaboration with famed cinematographer Dan Mindel (Star Wars, Star Trek, Pacific Rim)
• Smoother sharing process for Instagram
• Bug fixes and performance improvements

• New Laos HipstaPak, featuring a striking red color-shifted lens effect
• Bug fixes and performance improvements

• Freshly designed to take full advantage of the new amazing new screen on iPhone X
• All new photo editing interface with streamlined access to your most used tools
• Quickly find and compare lenses and films while editing with a new search feature
• HAPPY HOLIDAYS 2017! Hipsta Claus needs help again this year giving out free festive films, give and receive to collect all three!
• Other bug fixes and improvements

• New Fisheye SnapPak (available in HipstaMart), a carefully crafted reproduction of ultra-wide angle photography
• Fixed a bug causing the Photo of the Day widget to fail to refresh
• UI tweaks in Editing, including a few new gestures in the bottom toolbar:
- Swipe down to toggle between 'favorites' and 'pro tools'
- Swipe up (in pro tools) to toggle between 'active' and 'all' tools view
• Other bug fixes and enhancements

• Hipstamatic 342 fixes a bug that could cause a crash when shooting or editing with RAW (DNG) format images
—
Also new from version 341:
• New Fisheye SnapPak (available in HipstaMart), a carefully crafted reproduction of ultra-wide angle photography
• Fixed a bug causing the Photo of the Day widget to fail to refresh
• UI tweaks in Editing, including a few new gestures in the bottom toolbar:
- Swipe down to toggle between 'favorites' and 'pro tools'
- Swipe up (in pro tools) to toggle between 'active' and 'all' tools view
